Welcome to Minesweeper’s documentation!¶

class main.Main[source]¶

Source file for project. Creates instance of Menu class, begins game by the rules and menu

Attributes:
playing: Instance of the Menu class
begin()[source]¶

Begins game by calling for game rules and game menu to be displayed

class executive.Executive[source]¶

Executive class to act as game manager

Attributes:

game_over: Boolean to record current game status

cheat_mode: Boolean to record whether or not user is in cheat mode

myBoard: Instance of the Board class

check_win()[source]¶

Checks if all mines are flagged to determine is user has won the game

Returns:
0 if user has not won the game
play()[source]¶

Requests user input for playing the game as long as the game is not over Presents revealed board upon game over

setup()[source]¶

Generates board to spec of user input

class menu.Menu[source]¶

Menu class to act as game menu

Attributes:

choice: Integer value to record whether or not user wants to play again

myGame: Instance of the Executive class for managing the game

game_menu()[source]¶

Keeps the game running until user quits

game_rules()[source]¶

Prints the game instructions

type_error_handler()[source]¶

Handles any type error in users input

Returns:
check: Integer of users input if integer input
class square.Square[source]¶

Square class for managing properties of a square in Minesweeper

Attributes:

is_mine: Boolean to record whether or not a square is a mine

is_flagged: Boolean to record whether or not a square is flagged

is_revealed: Boolean to record whether or not a square is revealed

num_adj_mines: Integer to record number of mines adjacent to square

was_moved: Boolean to record whether or not a square has been moved

print_square()[source]¶

Prints the square with respect to the current status of the square’s attributes

class board.Board[source]¶

Board class that handles game board creation and functionality

Attributes:

width: Integer for width of the board

height: Integer for height of the board

mines_num: Integer for recording number of mines

num_flags: Integer for recording number of flags

grid: 2D array to store Square instances that make up board

first_selection: Boolean for recording whether or not an interaction is
the user’s first interaction

stopwatch: Instance of the Stopwatch class

count_nearby_mines(x, y, width, height, grid)[source]¶

Counts the number of adjacent mines for a given Square

Args:
x: Integer coordinate of Square on the x-axis y: Integer coordinate of Square on the y-axis width: Integer for width of board height: Integer for height of board grid: 2D array to act as game board
generate_mines(mines, width, height, grid)[source]¶

Randomly places mines on board

Args:
mines: Integer number of mines to be used width: Integer for width of board height: Integer for height of board grid: 2D array to act as game board
is_valid_cell(x, y)[source]¶

Checks that coordinates are within bounds of the board

Args:
x: Integer coordinate on the x-axis y: Integer coordinate on the y-axis
make_grid(width, height)[source]¶

Populates grid to user specification

Args:
width: Integer for width of board height: Integer for height of board
Returns:
grid: Populated 2D array to act as game board
mine_check(width, height, grid)[source]¶

Assigns number of adjacent mines for each Square to the Square member variable

Args:
width: Integer width of the board height: Integer height of the board grid: 2D array to act as game board
moveMines()[source]¶

Moves mines to a location that is not revealed nor is a mine

printCurrentTime()[source]¶

Prints a formatted time from the stopwatch

print_board(width, height, main_grid)[source]¶

Prints a formatted game board, followed by making a call to print a formatted time from stopwatch

Args:
width: Integer for width of board height: Integer for height of board main_grid: 2D array to be printed
resetGridMineCount(grid)[source]¶

Resets number of adjacent mines to 0 before evaluating the board

Args:
grid: 2D array to act as game board
reveal(x, y)[source]¶

Recursively calls reveal_adajenct to reveal Squares

Args:
x: Integer coordinate on the x-axis y: Integer coordinate on the y-axis
reveal_adjacent(x, y)[source]¶

Reveals cells that aren’t mines

Args:
x: Integer coordinate on the x-axis y: Integer coordinate on the y-axis
validTransformation(tolerance, i, j)[source]¶

Determines if moved mines are moved properly

Args:
tolerance: Integer weight for propability of successful move i: Integer coordinate on the x-axis j: Integer coordinate on the y-axis
Returns:
True if valid transformation
class stopwatch.Stopwatch[source]¶

Simple stopwatch class with functionality for starting, stopping, and getting current time on the stopwatch

Attributes:
start_time: Integer to record time (0 seconds) that stopwatch was
started

end_time: Integer to record number of seconds since stopwatch started

currentTime()[source]¶

Gets current time on stopwatch If start_time is 0, returns 0 Else returns time.time() - start_time rounded to nearest whole number

Returns:
Current time on switch as an integer
start()[source]¶

Starts stopwatch by setting the start_time to time.time(), rounded to the nearest whole number

stop()[source]¶

Stops stopwatch by settingt the end_time equal to time.time() - start_time, rounded to the nearest whole number
